definition: to resume classes
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to repeat/to double/to overlap/complex (not simple)/compound/composite/double/diplo-/duplicate/overlapping/to duplicate
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
subject/course/CL:門|门[men2]/class/lesson/CL:堂[tang2],節|节[jie2]/to levy/tax/form of divination

sentences.english: I undertake to resume studies following the expiry of the deferment period approved.
sentences.chinese: 本人会于已获批准的延迟修业期完结后复课。

sentences.english: Hongbai Township Central Primary School, I heard, have also started classes.
sentences.chinese: 我听说红白镇中心小学的孩子们也已经复课了。

sentences.english: Day of a few heads is checked, the following day stealthily resume classes.
sentences.chinese: 一些班头天查完，第二天便悄悄复课。

sentences.english: Classes at the school are expected to resume tomorrow.

definition: to stop classes/to close (of school)
to return to school (after an interruption)/to resume one's studies
school/CL:所[suo3]
to change major (at college)/to take up a new specialist subject/to transfer to a different medical department
to attend school on a temporary basis
entrance exam for senior middle school
(of an audio device) to repeat a recorded phrase (e.g. for language learning)
to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school
student who repeats (a course, grade etc) at school
general middle school
to suspend schooling/to defer study
to return to school
registration as a current student
vocational high school (abbr. to 職高|职高[zhi2 gao1])
the school (as a party in a contract, dispute etc)/the school authorities
third year in junior middle school
to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
